More Notes: Total in FrEDI
Damages under reactive adaptation (reasonably anticipated response) is USD9.4 Billion. Damages range from USD17 Billion under no adaptation.
Damages under proactive adaptation (optimal response) is USD7.5 Billion. Damages range from USD17 Billion under no adaptation.

While the chart depicts damages, avoided damages from adaptation would be represented by a reduction in these values. The figure does not specifically quantify adaptation benefits, thus 0 value for all numeric fields.
Value projected to 2090 (approximately 3% of US GDP); range from $700 billion to $7 trillion depending on emissions scenarios.

Figure A2 shows time series of sectoral damages across 10,000 projections through 2100. The text mentions uncertainty as 95% confidence intervals (shaded areas) around the mean and median damages. The figure shows increasing impacts in all sectors over time, but values vary greatly by sector. Using 0 as a placeholder value as it varies by sector. The quantiles similarly vary greatly by sector so zero is used as a placeholder

The sharp increase in damages in the coastal property damage sector after 2080 corresponds to a sharp increase in damages that occur after sea levels breach 100cm. Using 0 as a placeholder since I can't read the value.
